intro: Psychotria paloensis, commonly known as Palo Blanco, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and small, elliptical leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers, which are followed by bright red berries. Psychotria paloensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
